introduction: Banks are a riddle wrapped up in an enigma. We all kind of know that they do stuff with money we don

vocabulary.definition: something that is mysterious and difficult to understand
vocabulary.example: The disappearance of the ancient civilization remains an enigma to archaeologists.

vocabulary.definition: made in exact imitation of something valuable with the intention to deceive or defraud
vocabulary.example: The police seized a large amount of counterfeit money from the illegal operation.

vocabulary.definition: a person who has responsibility for taking care of or protecting something
vocabulary.example: The custodian of the museum ensures that the artifacts are properly preserved.
The teacher explained the complex scientific concept in a way that was comprehensible to the students.

vocabulary.definition: an act of giving financial assistance to a failing business or economy to save it from collapse
vocabulary.example: The government provided a bailout package to prevent the airline from going bankrupt.

vocabulary.definition: to find a way around or overcome (a problem or difficulty)
vocabulary.example: The company tried to circumvent the regulations by exploiting a legal loophole.
